results.title: The Supernatural
results.creator_credit: James Honeyborne, John Downer, Susan McMillan, BBC and Discovery Channel
results.brief_description: ‘Supernatural’ is a visually compelling investigation of the extrasensory and near-paranormal powers utilized by various animals in their daily struggle for survival. The series is presented in six parts, each focusing on examples of amazing and sometimes inexplicable animal and plant behaviour. In ‘Extrasensory perception’, watch sharks use electrosensors to track prey, and see a flight over the Sydney Opera House through the eyes of a parrot using ultraviolet light as a guide. ‘Outer limits’ explores incredible feats of endurance; lungfish burrowing into mud to escape droughts, and red sided garter snakes “defrosting” themselves after a cold snap. ‘Hidden forces’ looks at the internal magnet which draws green turtles back to the beaches of their birth to breed, and how fire ants are attracted to electric currents. ‘Time warp’ investigates how animal size and heart-rate are linked to lifespan. ‘Paranormal’ looks at the more bizarre side of nature; lizards who squirt blood from their eyes to deter predators and chickens and crocodiles who play dead when hypnotised. ‘Close encounters’ looks at the role enhanced senses play in animal life, using the story of Whisky, a truck-driver’s dog, and his six month journey to track down his owner. Also included is ‘Supernatural superstars’, a behind-the-scenes look at how the latest developments in science, cutting edge filming techniques and state of the art computer effects allowed the filmmakers to bring such an ambitious project to life.

results.title: The Superkids Fitness Video
results.brief_description: The fun way to co-ordination and fitness for girls and boys aged 6 to 12 years. Choreographed and performed by leading fitness consultants, Lisa Ferris (BSc) and Charles Cochrane (MEd) to help young children develop motor skills, co-ordination and sporting movements, mimed to the kind of energetic music kids love. No equipment required.

results.title: The Superb Lyrebird
results.creator_credit: Frank Muscolino and Australian Wildlife Video & Documentaries
results.brief_description: Director Frank Muscolino takes us into the cool bush habitat of the Superb Lyrebird (Menura Novahollandiae) around Mason Falls. We observe the lyrebirds in the treetops as well as at ground level, and hear their remarkable vocal range. The hen’s determined nest building is captured, as well as the display behaviour of the cock bird spreading his tail as he dances on the mound. Minimalist narration and some footage of neighbouring bush creatures such as reptiles and koalas is also seen.

results.title: The Sunshine state
results.brief_description: The agriculture, industries and tourist attractions of Queensland. Brisbane, Townsville and Cairns with their ports and industries; cattle grazing; banana harvesting; cane-cutting; the Barrier Reef with its chain of islands and underwater spectacle; a bird sanctuary; the beaches, hotels and nightlife of the Gold Coast and Surfers paradise. Narrated by Brian Henderson.

results.title: The Sunny Side of the Street
results.brief_description: This video looks at the changes taking place in home ownership and rental accommodation throughout Australia. the desire to own their own home is strong in most Australians and places tremendous pressure on housing prices. with high interest rates, increased cost of land and housing, the Great Australian Dream is fast becoming a nightmare. Housing development does not reflect the changes occurring in Australian society and a fresh approach to effectively meet these needs is required.

results.title: The Sun symbol in art
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford, Bailey Film Productions and Paul Burnford Productions
results.brief_description: Man has responded to the sun in various times and in different cultures. Included in this brief history is a sampling of works of art related to the sun. Examples include suns chiselled in stone, carved in wood, drawn in ink, and painted on canvas. Sun symbols by contemporary artist-designers are also shown. After briefly examining the method of organizing a radial pattern by combining several materials, the three important elements necessary in designing a sun symbol are described. Sequences are shown of fourth grade students creating their own imaginative and personal sun symbols - thus the concept of an object in nature as a source of inspiration to the artist is made concrete.

results.title: The Sun shines over Lhasa
results.brief_description: Documentary about the Tibetan city of Lhasa, its people, culture, history and attractions as seen through the eyes of the Chinese communist government since its invasion and subsequent rule of the Tibetan people.

results.title: The Sun pictures
results.creator_credit: David Bruce, Campbell Harper Films and Films of Scotland
results.brief_description: Features photographic portraits of the mid-19th century made by two Scottish photographers, David Octavius Hill and Robert Adamson, of soldiers, dignitaries, personal friends, Clydeside fishermen and the first assembly of the Church of Scotland. All were taken by means of long exposure in strong sunlight. Commentator: Aidan Thomson

results.title: The Sun and the earth: the upper atmosphere
results.creator_credit: Lothar Wolff, McGraw-Hill and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)
results.brief_description: The Earth’s atmosphere is known to be a region of diversity with different characteristics at various levels. Describes the location and nature of the phenomena observed in the upper atmosphere that extends from the turbopause outward into space. Explains their importance, and provides a sampling of the techniques used in studying them.

results.title: The Sun and the earth: magnetosphere
results.creator_credit: Lothar Wolff and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Magnetosphere is a relatively new scientific term, which has been given two meanings: 1. The region of space in which geomagnetic field forces exert a dominant influence upon the motion of charged particles. 2. A similar region surrounding other planets. The purpose of this film is to define its meaning and to describe the efforts of scientists to establish more accurate concepts about it and its significance.
